Description: “This recipe is for keeps! My first time making it and hubs says it's way better than the ones in the restaurants!”
Steps: Drizzle chicken with 1 tbsp oil, toss to coat. Sprinkle over Spice Mix, toss well to coat.
Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add onion and garlic, cook for 2 minutes. Add capsicum and cook for 1 minute. Transfer to bowl, cool.
Return pan to stove, reduce to medium heat. Add remaining 1/2 tbsp oil. Add chicken and cook for 3 minutes until deep golden. Turn and cook for 3 minutes until cooked through.
Transfer chicken to cutting board, rest for 2 minutes then dice and cool. Combine with capsicum mixture.

Description: In the summer, fresh and easy salads are always calling my name, and this avocado salad is one I turn to again and again.
Steps: Put all the salad ingredients in large bowl. Drizzle over lime juice and oil, sprinkle with salt, pepper and red chilli flakes.
Toss gently using your hands, gently separating the avocado slices as you go. Taste and add more lime if you want.
Tumble into a bowl and serve!
Ingredients: 2 big ripe avocados , cut into quarters then 1 cm slices
2 tbsp dill, finely chopped, optional recommended

Description: Arrabbiata sauce, known in Italian as sugo all'arrabbiata, is a spicy sauce for pasta made from garlic, tomatoes, and dried red chili peppers cooked in olive oil.
Steps: Sauté: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add garlic and stir for 10 seconds. Add cayenne and chilli flakes. Cook for 1 minute, or until garlic is light golden.
Add tomato, salt and pepper. Rinse out the tomato cans with the water and add into the pot.
Simmer: Turn up the heat to high, stir, then once it comes to a simmer, turn back down to medium heat and simmer for 15 minutes. (Taste check at 10 min: if sour, add the sugar.)
Cook pasta: Meanwhile, bring a large pot of water to the boil with the 1 tablespoon of salt. Add pasta and cook per packet directions.
Save water: Just before draining, give the pot a big stir (to agitate the starch) then scoop out 1 cup of the water and set aside. (Note 4) Drain pasta.

Toss: Add pasta into the sauce along with 1/2 cup of the pasta cooking water. Toss well (still on the stove) until the pasta is coated with the pasta sauce. Use extra pasta cooking water if needed, to loosen.
Serve: Divide between bowls and serve immediately with parmesan and parsley, if using.
Ingredients: 1 red cayenne pepper chilli , finely chopped (with seeds)

Description: These extraordinarily delicious, yet simple Garlic Noodles are a fusion Asian dish made famous by Thanh Long restaurant in San Francisco.
Steps: Noodles: Cook the noodles in a large saucepan per packet directions. Scoop out ~1/2 cup cooking water. Strain noodles and set aside.
Sauce: Melt butter in the same saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook, stirring until soft. Add oyster sauce, fish sauce, Maggi seasoning and 1/4 cup cooking water. Stir to combine.

Toss: Add cooked noodles, parmesan and green onion. Toss until the noodles are all coated, and the sauce is not pooled in the bottom of the saucepan. Add more cooking water 1 tbsp at the time, if needed to loosen the noodles.
Serve immediately!
Ingredients: 2 tbsp (6 cloves) garlic, finely minced (yep, a lot!)
2 tsp oyster sauce (sub vegetarian oyster sauce)
60 ml noodle cooking water , more if needed

Description: The most stunning of all cake glazes! Made with a simple mixture of cocoa, cream, sugar, water and gelatine.
Steps: Refrigerate cake layers for at least 1 hour until well-chilled (for easier handling). Then trim cake to make it level and frost cake with chocolate ganache so it's smooth and level (follow the tutorial in this post: How to Frost Cakes Smoothly).
After the ganache is smooth and level, refrigerate for at least 1 hour before coating with Mirror Glaze.

Make Mirror Glaze: Bloom gelatine: Place water in a small bowl. Then sprinkle gelatine across surface, mix just so all the powder is wet. Leave for 5 minutes: it will become like a rubber consistency. (This is called blooming gelatine.)
Whisk cocoa and water: Place cocoa and water in a medium saucepan then mix until virtually lump-free. It will be like a paste.

Add cream and sugar: Add a splash of cream to cocoa mix and stir. It will loosen up. Add remaining cream and sugar, then GENTLY continue to mix to combine. Do not mix vigorously and do not use a whisk.
Bring glaze to boil: Turn stove onto medium high heat. As soon as it comes to the boil, remove from the stove.
Dissolve gelatine: Add gelatine lump, then GENTLY stir until it dissolves and you have a smooth glossy glaze. (There may be some white foam, that's ok.)
Ingredients: 160 ml cream , pure / regular whipping cream, better than thickened/heavy cream

Description: “These beef tacos are quick to make, and taste absolutely amazing! Perfect for a busy weeknight dinner.”
Steps: Heat a skillet over medium heat and add 1 tbsp oil. Add onion and cook until translucent.
Add ground beef, breaking it up as it cooks. Season with taco seasoning, cook until browned.
Stir in tomato paste and water, cook for 5 minutes.
Serve beef mixture in taco shells with desired toppings like lettuce, cheese, and sour cream.

Description: “An easy and healthy veggie stir fry that’s loaded with flavor and vibrant colors.”
Steps: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant.
Add broccoli, bell pepper, carrots, and snow peas. Stir fry for 5-7 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, honey, and sesame oil. Pour over vegetables and toss to coat.
Serve with rice or noodles.
Ingredients: 1 small broccoli head, cut into florets

Description: “A classic Italian pasta dish that’s creamy, cheesy, and delicious. Ready in just 20 minutes!”
Steps: Cook spaghetti in salted water until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water and drain.
In a pan, cook bacon until crispy. Remove and set aside.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, Parmesan, and black pepper.
Toss the hot pasta with the egg mixture, adding reserved pasta water to create a creamy sauce. Stir in bacon and serve.

Description: “Rich and creamy Alfredo sauce over tender chicken and fettuccine. A comforting classic that never disappoints.”
Steps: Cook fettuccine according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a skillet, heat butter over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Stir in cream and bring to a simmer. Add Parmesan and cook until melted and smooth.
Toss cooked chicken and fettuccine in the sauce. Garnish with parsley and serve.

Description: “Simple yet flavorful, this salmon teriyaki recipe is perfect for a quick and healthy dinner.”
Steps: Whisk together soy sauce, honey, garlic, and ginger in a bowl.
Place salmon fillets in the marinade for 10 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add salmon and cook for 4-5 minutes on each side.
Brush with extra marinade and serve with steamed rice.

Description: “Juicy shrimp cooked in a garlic butter sauce with a hint of lemon. Perfect with pasta or crusty bread.”
Steps: Melt butter in a large pan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add shrimp and cook until pink, about 2 minutes per side.
Stir in lemon juice and parsley. Serve immediately with pasta or bread.

Description: “This takeout-style beef and broccoli stir-fry is quick, easy, and absolutely delicious.”
Steps: Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Add beef and cook until browned.
Remove beef from the pan and set aside.
Add broccoli and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Stir in soy sauce, hoisin sauce, and garlic. Return beef to the pan and toss to coat.
Ingredients: 1 small broccoli head, cut into florets

Description: “A simple and delicious Margherita pizza with fresh mozzarella, basil, and a perfect tomato sauce.”
Steps: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F).
Roll out pizza dough and place on a baking sheet.
Spread tomato sauce over the dough and top with fresh mozzarella.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until the crust is golden and cheese is melted.
Garnish with fresh basil before serving.

Description: “Crispy chicken cutlets topped with marinara sauce and melted mozzarella. A family favorite!”
Steps: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
Dredge chicken in flour, then egg, then breadcrumbs.
Heat oil in a pan and fry chicken until golden on both sides.
Transfer to a baking dish, top with marinara sauce and mozzarella, and bake for 15 minutes.
